page.title: 14ST PETER'S CENTRE, OLD TOWN
page.content: Children from St. Mary Magdalene's School interviewed the warden, Mrs. Mitten, who told us that the{three {halls}were in constant use by{young {and old.}More{retired people}used them than others, but there was a{Mother {and Toddler group}on a Friday morning. {Church groups}used them for youth activities, parties and after church coffee times.{Adult Education}used it for art and dancing classes, whilst during the summer months it was extensively used for{English language {classes for foreign students. The halls could be hired for private functions and meals could be prepared. Mrs. Mitten thought it was an important part of general community life here. Other centres are at{Sidley and{Pebsham. The Stables}block next to the centre has recently been converted into rooms especially for church use.
